With all of the variants of the RG31 produced over the years, we have been working on producing the MMPV Type II Program of Record. This model of the RG31 is the legitimate version that will be supported for with all logistics, maintenance and sustainment efforts now and in the future. All prior RG31s will be going through a conversion or rebuild process to convert them over to the Program of Record.

Well, it does seem to be that way at times. But in this case, the weather information provided in the post is not accurate. Perhaps no one responsible for the LEAD Facebook page has been monitoring the forecast status overnight?  I wonder why not? As of 0230 this morning (now) there is only a Winter Weather Advisory for the area. No snow is forecast -- just a bit of ice this morning, with a high of 36 degrees by afternoon. So, as the post so correctly states -- "use your judgement and do what is best for you". And for current, accurate, and official weather info for South Central PA, see this site www.weather.gov/ctp
